required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Oxidative Stress and L-CBMN Cytome Assay in Obese After 3 Weeks VLCD
clinical_study.official_title: Oxidative Stress and L-CBMN Cytome Assay Parameters Levels in Severely Obese With BMI ≥ 35kg/m2 After 3 Weeks 567 kcal Hospital Controlled VLCD

lead_sponsor.agency: Special Hospital for Extended Treatment of Duga Resa

collaborator.agency: Institute for Medical Research and Occupational Health

clinical_study.source: Special Hospital for Extended Treatment of Duga Resa

brief_summary.textblock: Obesity leads to physiological imbalance resulting in hyperglycemia, dyslipidaemia and inflammation and can generate systematic oxidative stress through multiple biochemical mechanisms. Oxidative stress (OS) can induce DNA damage and inhibit DNA repair mechanisms. Very low calorie diet (VLCD) have rapid positive effect on weight loss, glucose homeostasis, insulin resistance, inflammation and OS. The aim of this study is to determine the effect of a three-week VLCD on anthropometric, biochemical and genomic parameters in individuals with BMI ≥ 35kg/m2.

detailed_description.textblock: Obesity is a complex chronic multifactorial disease associated with concomitant or increased risk for chronic inflammation, insulin resistance, dyslipidemia, oxidative stress, type 2 diabetes, cardiovascular disease, stroke and multiple cancer types. Oxidative stress (OS) can cause permanent DNA damage which could be detected with lymphocytes cytokinesis-block micronucleus (L-CBMN) cytome assay. Weight loss and improvement of dietary habits in people with obesity can affect genome stability and have beneficial effects on insulin sensitivity, inflammation and OS. Effects of very low calorie diet (VLCD) on DNA damage are scarce. The aim of this study is to determine the effect of a three-week VLCD used in Special Hospital for extended treatment of Duga Resa in patients with BMI ≥ 35kg/m2 on permanent DNA damage, lipid profile, insulin resistance, inflammation and anthropometric parameters.

primary_outcome.measure: The changes in body mass index
primary_outcome.description: Body mass index is calculated by dividing body mass (kg) with square of body height (m)

primary_outcome.measure: The changes in the body fat mass
primary_outcome.description: Body fat mass (kg) assessed with bioelectrical impedance method

primary_outcome.measure: The changes in the skeletal muscle mass
primary_outcome.description: Skeletal muscle mass (kg) assessed with bioelectrical impedance method

primary_outcome.measure: The changes in the percent body fat
primary_outcome.description: Percent body fat (%) assessed with bioelectrical impedance method

primary_outcome.measure: The changes in fasting glucose concentration

primary_outcome.description: Concentrations of triglycerides (mmo/L), LDL (mmol/L), HDL (mmol/L) cholesterol (mmol/L)

primary_outcome.measure: The changes in homeostatic model assessment (HOMA) index
primary_outcome.description: HOMA index is calculated according to the following formula: glucose (mmol/L) x insulin (mIU/L)/22.5
Concentration of C-reactive protein (mg/L) and total white blood cell count

secondary_outcome.description: Concentration of glutathione (RFU) and reactive oxygen species (RFU)
Frequency of micronucleus, nuclear buds, nucleoplasmic bridges, apoptotic and necrotic cells among 1000 lymphocytes

arm_group.description: Use of very low calorie diet prepared in the hospital

intervention.description: In hospital patients will eat prepared diet with 567 kcal a day during 3 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- body mass index ≥ 35 kg/m2
Exclusion Criteria:
- pregnancy
- actual tumor diseases
- recent diagnostic or treatment exposures to ionizing radiation in the period of one year
- individuals not willing to stay 3 weeks under supervision under full 24 h surveillance from the medical stuff

overall_official.affiliation: Institute for Medical Research and Occupational Health
Special Hospital for Extended Treatment of Duga Resa

facility.name: Special Hospital for Extended Treatment of Duga Resa
